title: Arctic Wolf Aurora Endpoint Security Process and System Activity
description: This dashboard provides a comprehensive summary of Aurora Focus process-based, file-based, registry-based, memory-based, log-based events.

definition.content:
[Arctic Wolf Aurora Endpoint Security](https://docs.arcticwolf.com/bundle/AES-Overview/page/What-is-Aurora-Endpoint-Security.html) is a unified solution that helps to tackle modern threats. It provides comprehensive capabilities to detect and protect against threats across endpoints.

This dashboard provides a comprehensive summary of Aurora Focus process-based, file-based, registry-based, memory-based, log-based events.

For more information, see the [Arctic Wolf Aurora Endpoint Security Integration Documentation](https://docs.datadoghq.com/integrations/arctic_wolf_aurora_endpoint_security/).

**Tips**
- Use the timeframe selector in the upper-right corner of the dashboard to change the default timeframe.
- Clone this dashboard to rearrange, modify, and add widgets and visualizations.

Tracks detection events involving target processes, including the instigating process, target process details, command lines, file paths, hashes, severity, device and user information, and detection rule details. Helps monitor suspicious or malicious process activity and provides insight into which processes triggered detections on endpoints.

Tracks detection events involving target processes, including the instigating process, target file details, command lines, file paths, hashes, severity, device and user information, and detection rule details. Helps monitor suspicious or malicious process activity and provides insight into which processes triggered detections on endpoints.

Captures memory based events on devices, including the detection rule triggered, device details, instigating process information, event severity and many more. Provides context on processes accessing or modifying memory, timestamps of events, and zone information, helping track potentially malicious or suspicious memory activity, understand which process caused the event.

Tracks detection events involving registry items on devices, including the instigating process, target registry key and value, severity, device and user information, and detection rule details. Helps monitor suspicious or malicious registry changes and provides insight into which processes triggered these events on endpoints.

Log-based events captures detection rule details, device information, and event identifiers. They include the instigating processs name, file path, SHA256, command line, and owner, along with the security provider generating the Windows event log message. Severity levels (High, Medium, Low, Info) and the Windows Event ID are also recorded, providing full context for log-based detection activity.

Gives a focused view of incoming Process, File, Registry, Memory and Log based logs, showing event statuses over time and highlighting critical entries to help with quick review and investigation of important security events.

search.query: source:arctic-wolf-aurora-endpoint-security service:detection-events @event_type:(OpticsCaeProcessEvent OR OpticsCaeFileEvent OR OpticsCaeRegistryEvent OR OpticsCaeMemoryEvent OR OpticsCaeLogEvent) $event_type $event_name $severity $device_name $security_provider $target_registry_valuename $target_file_owner $target_process_name $target_process_owner

query.query_string: source:arctic-wolf-aurora-endpoint-security service:detection-events @event_type:(OpticsCaeProcessEvent OR OpticsCaeFileEvent OR OpticsCaeRegistryEvent OR OpticsCaeMemoryEvent OR OpticsCaeLogEvent) @status:critical $event_type $event_name $severity $device_name $security_provider $target_registry_valuename $target_file_owner $target_process_name $target_process_owner
